body_html: As I answered on StackOverflow, this is intended behavior when a dimension cannot be statically inferred. In fact, a dimension size of None is compatible with every concrete dimension size (it acts as a wildcard), and any constraints will be checked at runtime.
body_text: As I answered on StackOverflow, this is intended behavior when a dimension cannot be statically inferred. In fact, a dimension size of None is compatible with every concrete dimension size (it acts as a wildcard), and any constraints will be checked at runtime.
body: As I [answered](http://stackoverflow.com/a/34996139/3574081) on StackOverflow, this is intended behavior when a dimension cannot be statically inferred. In fact, a dimension size of `None` is compatible with _every_ concrete dimension size (it acts as a wildcard), and any constraints will be checked at runtime.
